tweet: I wish you and your family a safe, peaceful Thanksgiving. As we reflect on our many blessings and share our gratitude with loved ones, let us take a moment to give thanks for the brave men and women in uniform who sacrifice so much so freedom and opportunity can endure. pic.twitter.com/ioPRQr8v3S

I introduced a bipartisan bill to provide a much needed update to the estate tax to help our farmers keep more of their hard-earned dollars and protect family-owned businesses from the burden of this harmful tax. https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/5259 …

Today, I joined my colleagues in the Indiana delegation to send a letter to @FERC voicing concerns on the propane supply impacting Hoosier families, farmers, and businesses in our community.  I’ll continue to monitor the situation. pic.twitter.com/Fti8oQdvnJ

I'm also still waiting to see Speaker Pelosi bring my commonsense bill, the STOP for School Buses Act, to a vote. School bus safety is something we can all agree on. We're #NotOneStepCloser to what really matters. So, when are we going to get back to work? (3/3)

And yet, one thing remains the same: House Democrats have wanted to impeach the president since day one. These hearings have kept us from moving forward on important things, like passing USMCA and funding our military. #NotOneStepCloser (2/3)

Another week of impeachment hearings comes to an end. That means over the last 2 weeks, the American people have watched the House Democrats use 5 legislative days to hold 7 hearings and hear from 12 witnesses. #NotOneStepCloser (1/3)

According to @CDCgov, about 1 in 10 people may have a seizure at some point in their life. During National Epilepsy Awareness Month, you can educate yourself and others about epilepsy and seizure first aid at  http://epilepsy.com/FirstAid . #NEAM2019 #StaySafeSide
